sentences.en: A devaluation causes the price of one currency to drop in relation to other currencies.
sentences.cn: 贬值,是使一种货币对别的货币的比值下跌.

sentences.en: Devaluation would only give the economy a brief respite.
sentences.cn: 贬值只能让经济得到暂时的缓解。

sentences.en: Financial market is shocked by the news of the devaluation.
sentences.cn: 金融市场被货币贬值的新闻所震惊.

sentences.en: France is also set against devaluation.
sentences.cn: 法国也坚决反对货币贬值。

sentences.en: Further devaluation of pound will surely cause monetary crisis.
sentences.cn: 英镑进一步贬值必将引起货币危机.

sentences.en: He blamed injudicious comments by bankers for last week's devaluation.
sentences.cn: 他将上周的货币贬值归咎于银行家所作的不当评论。

sentences.en: In the long term , as every economist knows, inflation brings devaluation.
sentences.cn: 然而, 就像所有经济学家所熟知的,从长远来看, 膨胀必然会带来贬值.

sentences.en: It will lead to devaluation of a number of European currencies.
sentences.cn: 这将会造成数种欧洲货币的贬值。

sentences.en: Nothing like that has happened in Europe — yet. But it’s certainly within the realm of possibility, especially as the pain of austerity and internal devaluation drags on.
sentences.cn: 在欧洲还没有发生这样的事情，但肯定在可能性范畴之内，尤其是随着财政紧缩与内部贬值痛苦的持续，这种可能会增大。

sentences.en: Once you have something, then immediately devaluation.
sentences.cn: 一件东西一旦拥有，便马上贬值。

sentences.en: Share price readjusted quickly to the news of the devaluation.
sentences.cn: 货币贬值的消息一传出,股票价格就迅速重新调整了.

sentences.en: The devaluation of the pound has put our estimates out by several thousands.
sentences.cn: 英镑一贬值使我们的估计数差了几千镑.

sentences.en: The devaluation of the pound should have been a warning sign.
sentences.cn: 英镑的贬值应该为其敲响警钟了.

sentences.en: The risk of devaluation (of the currency) does not affect them as much as it does other investors.
sentences.cn: （货币）贬值风险对他们的影响不像对其他投资商那么大。

sentences.en: There has been the biggest devaluation money and a huge fiscal deficit.
sentences.cn: 当前出现了最严重的货币贬值和巨大的财政赤字.

sentences.en: Two other concepts related to the value of a currency are devaluation or revaluation.
sentences.cn: 另外两个涉及某种通货价值的概念是法定升值和法定贬值.

sentences.en: Until now, a devaluation of the dollar seemed inconceivable.
sentences.cn: 直到现在，美元的贬值似乎都无法想象。

sentences.en: Without the option of devaluation, their medium - term outlook looks less than rosy.
sentences.cn: 无法选择货币贬值, 她们的 中期 前景看起来毫不光明.

words.tran_cn: 使…贬值；降低…的价值；减少…的重要性
